The idea behind the PEC is that the commercialisation of human plasma could increase
the supply and improve the quality of blood products available for medical
treatment.
According to the rapporteur of the PEC DO PLASMA, [redacted_name], it is
health professionals complain about the difficulty of obtaining plasma in
adequate quantity to serve the country's population.
She recalls that in 2020, the Federal Court of Auditors (TCU) notified the Ministry
of Health for the waste of almost 600 thousand litres of plasma, which were not
used to produce blood products, which is equivalent to more than 2.7 million
blood donations, according to the Public Prosecutor's Office. The damage could reach R$ 1.3
billion a year, according to the Public Prosecutor's Office. "In other words, Brazil takes
blood, uses the red blood cells and often the plasma is
wasted", says the senator.
